[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]By the gods...{END}

[Portrait]Wiegraf
[Dialog]So, you've come.{END}

Draw your sword, <Ramza>.{END}

Not in the mood? I hope you will
not object to me drawing mine.{END}

I pity you, Wiegraf. More than you can know.


What must Milleuda think, to see you now?


You would sell your soul to the Lucavi to
slake your thirst for revenge.{END}

Revenge? You think that is what
drives me?

I have no such petty concerns.
I do not fight to avenge Milleuda's 
death.
I sow the seeds of chaos in the
world of men, and reap the
anguished cries of the weak.
But worry not, <Ramza>.
Yours is a special case.
I shall kill -you- myself!{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]Auracite is the work of demons, not gods-
the Zodiac Braves, their unholy knights.
Heroes of a false legend!{END}

*chuckle* All such tales of gods and their
miracles are false.

Those who would lead prefer that history suit
their needs, and rewrite it to see that it does.

And why shouldn't they? The fault lies not with
them.

The reeking masses yearn for gods and miracles.
It is their opiate, and they consume it greedily.

The people do not endeavor towards greatness,
but rather mire themselves in their petty
strifes-shackles on the feet of man.
Their leaders give them no more than that for
which they clamor. It is history's oldest and
most oft-repeated tale.
Do men exploit this weakness to dominate their
fellows? Mayhap they do.

But they succeed only because the people are
eager to know such dominion.

Gods are only illusions born of man's fear.


It is they who see this charade for what it is
and join in the pageantry who are to blame.{END}

And you? You did not conquer your fear.
You turned to the auracite to find your
miracle.{END}

It is -because- I am weak, -because-
I fear, that I turn to the gods.

Can you claim to be free of weakness
and fear?{END}

No, but I endeavor to be so!{END}

Your endeavors are soon ended!{END}

[Portrait]Wiegraf
[Dialog]You are...stronger than I had thought...{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]You cannot run, Wiegraf!{END}

Show yourself!{END}

This has gone on long enough.{END}

[Portrait]Belias, the Gigas
[Dialog]I am come.{END}

You fight alone no more?
Then nor shall I.

Here join me, followers
loyal and true.{END}

The battle now is joined, <Ramza>
Beoulve! Behold for true fell pow'r
of the Dark!{END}

[Portrait]Belias, the Gigas
[Dialog]Unnngaahhh! Brought down by hand of mortal
man!{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]Alma!{END}
